abstracts.cdata!:
Republic of Guinea-Bissau in the amount
            of SDR 4 million on the terms set out in the
            President's Memorandum. Mr. Solomon wished to be
            recorded as abstaining. Directors commended the authorities
            for the recent progress made in economic stabilization,
            which helped to consolidate recent policy achievements in
            the wake of Guinea-Bissau reaching the Heavily-indebted Poor
            Country (HIPC) completion point. Directors noted the
            remaining challenges to more rapid growth and effective
            poverty reduction, including strengthening economic
            infrastructure, improving the business environment, and
            promoting activity in such sectors as agriculture that
            strongly impact income generation and poverty reduction.
            Finally, Directors acknowledged that high risks remain and
            encouraged the authorities and donors to draw from the
            lessons of the 2011 World Development Report (WDR) to focus
            on poverty reduction, access to services and effective
            judicial systems.
